meanings.definition: The state or quality of being globular or spherical in shape.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the globosities of the planets in his painting.
meanings.sent2: The globosities of the marbles made them easy to roll.
meanings.sent3: The globosities of the balloons made them look like colorful planets.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks had the globosities of perfectly ripe peaches.
meanings.sent5: The globosities of the bubbles in the fizzy drink sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A rounded or swollen part or protuberance.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the globosities on the patient's knee.
meanings.sent2: The globosities on the tree trunk indicated a termite infestation.
meanings.sent3: The globosities on the toy made it wobble amusingly.
meanings.sent4: The globosities of the clouds in the sky resembled fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent5: The globosities on the caterpillar's body were fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: A rounded or swollen object or mass.
meanings.sent1: The chef sculpted the cake into globosities for a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The globosities of the snowballs made them perfect for a snowball fight.
meanings.sent3: The globosities of the rubber band ball bounced unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: The globosities of the rocks in the riverbed created a natural obstacle course.
meanings.sent5: The globosities of the clouds gathered ominously before the storm.
